OPTION.NAME: -c
OPTION.DESC: Compile to object file

OPTION.NAME: -E
OPTION.DESC: Preprocess only; do not compile, assemble or link

OPTION.NAME: -o
OPTION.DESC: Place the output into <file>

OPTION.NAME: -combine
OPTION.DESC: Pass multiple source files to compiler at once

OPTION.NAME: -x
OPTION.DESC: Specify the language of the input files

OPTION.NAME: -v
OPTION.DESC: Display the programs invoked by the compiler

OPTION.NAME: -V
OPTION.DESC: Run gcc version number <version>, if installed

OPTION.NAME: --version
OPTION.DESC: Display compiler version information

OPTION.NAME: -ansi
OPTION.DESC: A synonym for -std=c89 (for C) or -std=c++98 (for C++)

OPTION.NAME: -std=
OPTION.DESC: Standard to conform to

OPTION.NAME: -fhosted
OPTION.DESC: Assume normal C execution environment

OPTION.NAME: -ffreestanding
OPTION.DESC: Do not assume that standard C libraries and 'main' exist

OPTION.NAME: -fopenmp
OPTION.DESC: Enable OpenMP (implies -frecursive in Fortran)

OPTION.NAME: -traditional-cpp
OPTION.DESC: Enable traditional preprocessing

OPTION.NAME: -fsigned-char
OPTION.DESC: Make 'char' signed by default

OPTION.NAME: -funsigned-char
OPTION.DESC: Make 'char' unsigned by default

OPTION.NAME: -ffor-scope
OPTION.DESC: Scope of for-init-statement variables is local to the loop

OPTION.NAME: -fgnu-keywords
OPTION.DESC: Recognize GNU-defined keywords

OPTION.NAME: -foperator-names
OPTION.DESC: Recognize C++ keywords like 'compl' and 'xor'

OPTION.NAME: -frtti
OPTION.DESC: Generate run time type descriptor information

OPTION.NAME: -fstats
OPTION.DESC: Display statistics accumulated during compilation

OPTION.NAME: -nostdinc++
OPTION.DESC: Do not search standard system include directories for C++

OPTION.NAME: -Wnon-virtual-dtor
OPTION.DESC: Warn about non-virtual destructors

OPTION.NAME: -Wreorder
OPTION.DESC: Warn when the compiler reorders code

OPTION.NAME: -Wold-style-cast
OPTION.DESC: Warn if a C-style cast is used in a program

OPTION.NAME: -Woverloaded-virtual
OPTION.DESC: Warn about overloaded virtual function names

OPTION.NAME: -Wsign-promo
OPTION.DESC: Warn when overload promotes from unsigned to signed

OPTION.NAME: -fsyntax-only
OPTION.DESC: Check for syntax errors, then stop

OPTION.NAME: -pedantic
OPTION.DESC: Issue warnings needed for strict compliance to the standard

OPTION.NAME: -w
OPTION.DESC: Suppress warnings

OPTION.NAME: -W
OPTION.DESC: Warning options

OPTION.NAME: -dumpmachine
OPTION.DESC: Display the compiler's target processor

OPTION.NAME: -dumpversion
OPTION.DESC: Display the version of the compiler

OPTION.NAME: -feliminate-dwarf2-dups
OPTION.DESC: Perform DWARF2 duplicate elimination

OPTION.NAME: -g
OPTION.DESC: Generate debug information

OPTION.NAME: -p
OPTION.DESC: Enable function profiling

OPTION.NAME: -save-temps
OPTION.DESC: Do not delete intermediate files

OPTION.NAME: -time
OPTION.DESC: Time the execution of each subprocess

OPTION.NAME: -O
OPTION.DESC: Optimization level. 0 is none, s optimizes for space

OPTION.NAME: -ffinite-math-only
OPTION.DESC: Assume no NaNs or infinities are generated

OPTION.NAME: -finline-functions
OPTION.DESC: Integrate simple functions into their callers

OPTION.NAME: -finline-functions-called-once
OPTION.DESC: Integrate functions called once into their callers

OPTION.NAME: -fomit-frame-pointer
OPTION.DESC: When possible do not generate stack frames

OPTION.NAME: -fwhole-program
OPTION.DESC: Perform whole program optimizations

OPTION.NAME: -C
OPTION.DESC: Do not discard comments

OPTION.NAME: -D
OPTION.DESC: Define a macro -Dmacro[=defn]

OPTION.NAME: -H
OPTION.DESC: Print the name of header files as they are used

OPTION.NAME: -include
OPTION.DESC: -include file

OPTION.NAME: -imultilib
OPTION.DESC: -imultilib dir

OPTION.NAME: -MD
OPTION.DESC: Generate make dependencies and compile

OPTION.NAME: -MP
OPTION.DESC: Generate phony targets for all headers

OPTION.NAME: -nostdinc
OPTION.DESC: Do not search standard system include directories (those specified with -isystem will still be used)

OPTION.NAME: -remap
OPTION.DESC: Remap file names when including files

OPTION.NAME: -undef
OPTION.DESC: Do not predefine system-specific and GCC-specific macros

OPTION.NAME: -U
OPTION.DESC: Undefine <macro>>

OPTION.NAME: -Wp,
OPTION.DESC: Pass comma-separated <options> on to the preprocessor

OPTION.NAME: -Xpreprocessor
OPTION.DESC: -Xpreprocessor option

OPTION.NAME: -Wa,
OPTION.DESC: -Wa,options: comma separated list of assembler options

OPTION.NAME: -Xassembler
OPTION.DESC: -Xassembler option

OPTION.NAME: -l
OPTION.DESC: -l library (to search for)

OPTION.NAME: -nostdlib
OPTION.DESC: Only use library directories specified on the command line

OPTION.NAME: -pie
OPTION.DESC: Create a position independent executable

OPTION.NAME: -static
OPTION.DESC: Do not link against shared libraries

OPTION.NAME: -shared
OPTION.DESC: Create a shared library

OPTION.NAME: -Wl,
OPTION.DESC: -Wl,options: comma separted list of linker options

OPTION.NAME: -Xlinker
OPTION.DESC: -Xlinker option

OPTION.NAME: -T
OPTION.DESC: Linker script

OPTION.NAME: -B
OPTION.DESC: -B dir (add dir to search path)

OPTION.NAME: -I
OPTION.DESC: Add <dir> to the end of the main include path

OPTION.NAME: -b
OPTION.DESC: Run gcc for target <machine>, if installed

OPTION.NAME: -u
OPTION.DESC: Start with undefined reference to SYMBOL

OPTION.NAME: -fexceptions
OPTION.DESC: Enable exception handling

OPTION.NAME: -fpic
OPTION.DESC: Generate position-independent code if possible (small mode)

OPTION.NAME: -fPIC
OPTION.DESC: Generate position-independent code if possible (large mode)

OPTION.NAME: -fpie
OPTION.DESC: Generate position-independent code for executables if possible (small mode)

OPTION.NAME: -fPIE
OPTION.DESC: Generate position-independent code for executables if possible (large mode)

OPTION.NAME: -fshort-enums
OPTION.DESC: Use the narrowest integer type possible for enumeration types

OPTION.NAME: -fshort-double
OPTION.DESC: Use the same size for double as for float

OPTION.NAME: -fshort-wchar
OPTION.DESC: Force the underlying type for 'wchar_t' to be 'unsigned short'

OPTION.NAME: -fverbose-asm
OPTION.DESC: Add extra commentary to assembler output

OPTION.NAME: -fpack-struct
OPTION.DESC: structure packing [member alignment] -fpack-struct[=n]

OPTION.NAME: -fbounds-check
OPTION.DESC: Generate code to check bounds before indexing arrays

OPTION.NAME: -mabi=
OPTION.DESC: Specify an ABI

OPTION.NAME: -mabort-on-noreturn
OPTION.DESC: Generate a call to abort if a noreturn function returns

OPTION.NAME: -mapcs-float
OPTION.DESC: Pass FP arguments in FP registers

OPTION.NAME: -mapcs-frame
OPTION.DESC: Generate APCS conformant stack frames

OPTION.NAME: -march=
OPTION.DESC: Specify the name of the target architecture

OPTION.NAME: -mbig-endian
OPTION.DESC: Assume target CPU is configured as big endian

OPTION.NAME: -mcallee-super-interworking
OPTION.DESC: Thumb: Assume non-static functions may be called from ARM code

OPTION.NAME: -mcaller-super-interworking
OPTION.DESC: Thumb: Assume function pointers may go to non-Thumb aware code

OPTION.NAME: -mcirrus-fix-invalid-insns
OPTION.DESC: Cirrus: Place NOPs to avoid invalid instruction combinations

OPTION.NAME: -mfix-cortex-m3-ldrd
OPTION.DESC: Avoid overlapping destination and address registers on LDRD instructions that may trigger Cortex-M3 errata.

OPTION.NAME: -mfloat-abi=
OPTION.DESC: Specify if floating point hardware should be used

OPTION.NAME: -mfpu=
OPTION.DESC: Specify the name of the target floating point hardware/format

OPTION.NAME: -mhard-float
OPTION.DESC: Alias for -mfloat-abi=hard

OPTION.NAME: -mlittle-endian
OPTION.DESC: Assume target CPU is configured as little endian

OPTION.NAME: -mlong-calls
OPTION.DESC: Generate call insns as indirect calls, if necessary

OPTION.NAME: -mpic-register=
OPTION.DESC: Specify the register to be used for PIC addressing

OPTION.NAME: -mpoke-function-name
OPTION.DESC: Store function names in object code

OPTION.NAME: -msoft-float
OPTION.DESC: Alias for -mfloat-abi=soft

OPTION.NAME: -mstructure-size-boundary=
OPTION.DESC: Specify the minimum bit alignment of structures

OPTION.NAME: -mthumb
OPTION.DESC: Compile for the Thumb not the ARM

OPTION.NAME: -mthumb-interwork
OPTION.DESC: Support calls between Thumb and ARM instruction sets

OPTION.NAME: -mtune=
OPTION.DESC: Tune code for the given processor

OPTION.NAME: -mwords-little-endian
OPTION.DESC: Assume big endian bytes, little endian words

OPTION.NAME: -k
OPTION.DESC: generate PIC code

OPTION.NAME: -mapcs-reentrant
OPTION.DESC: re-entrant code

OPTION.NAME: -matpcs
OPTION.DESC: code is ATPCS conformant

OPTION.NAME: -mapcs-stack-check
OPTION.DESC: use stack size checking

OPTION.NAME: -mcpu=
OPTION.DESC: assemble for given CPU name

OPTION.NAME: -meabi=
OPTION.DESC: assemble for given eabi version

OPTION.NAME: -EB
OPTION.DESC: assemble code for a big-endian cpu

OPTION.NAME: -EL
OPTION.DESC: assemble code for a little-endian cpu

OPTION.NAME: --fix-v4bx
OPTION.DESC: Allow BX in ARMv4 code

OPTION.NAME: --thumb-entry=
OPTION.DESC: Set the entry point to be given Thumb symbol

OPTION.NAME: --fix-v4bx-interworking
OPTION.DESC: Rewrite BX rn branch to ARMv4 interworking veneer

OPTION.NAME: --use-blx
OPTION.DESC: Enable use of BLX instructions

OPTION.NAME: -I
OPTION.DESC: Assume input file is in format (bfdname)

OPTION.NAME: -O
OPTION.DESC: Create an output file in format (bfdname)

OPTION.NAME: -B
OPTION.DESC: (arch) Set arch of output file, when input is binary

OPTION.NAME: -F
OPTION.DESC: (bfdname) Set both input and output format to (bfdname)

OPTION.NAME: --debugging
OPTION.DESC: Convert debugging information, if possible

OPTION.NAME: -p
OPTION.DESC: Copy modified/access timestamps to the output

OPTION.NAME: -j
OPTION.DESC: Only copy section (name) into the output

OPTION.NAME: --add-gnu-debuglink=
OPTION.DESC: (file) Add section .gnu_debuglink linking to (file)

OPTION.NAME: -R
OPTION.DESC: Remove section (name) from the output

OPTION.NAME: -S
OPTION.DESC: Remove all symbol and relocation information

OPTION.NAME: -g
OPTION.DESC: Remove all debugging symbols and sections

OPTION.NAME: --strip-unneeded
OPTION.DESC: Remove all symbols not needed by relocations

OPTION.NAME: -N
OPTION.DESC: Do not copy symbol (name)

OPTION.NAME: --strip-unneeded-symbol
OPTION.DESC: Do not copy symbol (name) unless needed by relocations

OPTION.NAME: --only-keep-debug
OPTION.DESC: Strip everything but the debug information

OPTION.NAME: --extract-symbol
OPTION.DESC: Remove section contents but keep symbols

OPTION.NAME: -K
OPTION.DESC: Do not strip symbol (name)

OPTION.NAME: --keep-file-symbols
OPTION.DESC: Do not strip file symbol(s)

OPTION.NAME: --localize-hidden
OPTION.DESC: Turn all ELF hidden symbols into locals

OPTION.NAME: -L
OPTION.DESC: Force symbol (name) to be marked as a local

OPTION.NAME: --globalize-symbol
OPTION.DESC: Force symbol (name) to be marked as a global

OPTION.NAME: -G
OPTION.DESC: Localize all symbols except (name)

OPTION.NAME: -W
OPTION.DESC: Force symbol (name) to be marked as a weak

OPTION.NAME: --weaken
OPTION.DESC: Force all global symbols to be marked as weak

OPTION.NAME: -w
OPTION.DESC: Permit wildcard in symbol comparison

OPTION.NAME: -x
OPTION.DESC: Remove all non-global symbols

OPTION.NAME: -X
OPTION.DESC: Remove any compiler-generated symbols

OPTION.NAME: -i
OPTION.DESC: Only copy one out of every (number) bytes

OPTION.NAME: -b
OPTION.DESC: Select byte (num) in every interleaved block

OPTION.NAME: --gap-fill
OPTION.DESC: Fill gaps between sections with (val)

OPTION.NAME: --pad-to
OPTION.DESC: Pad the last section up to address (addr)

OPTION.NAME: --set-start
OPTION.DESC: Set the start address to (addr)

OPTION.NAME: --change-start
OPTION.DESC: Add (incr) to the start address

OPTION.NAME: --change-addresses
OPTION.DESC: Add (incr) to LMA, VMA and start addresses

OPTION.NAME: --change-section-address
OPTION.DESC: (name){=|+|-}(val)\nChange LMA and VMA of section (name) by (val)

OPTION.NAME: --change-section-lma
OPTION.DESC: (name){=|+|-}(val)\nChange the LMA of section (name) by (val)

OPTION.NAME: --change-section-vma
OPTION.DESC: (name){=|+|-}(val)\nChange the VMA of section (name) by (val)

OPTION.NAME: --no-change-warnings
OPTION.DESC: Don't warn if a named section does not exist

OPTION.NAME: --change-warnings
OPTION.DESC: Warn if a named section does not exist

OPTION.NAME: --set-section-flags
OPTION.DESC: (name)=(flags)\nSet section (name)'s properties to (flags)

OPTION.NAME: --add-section
OPTION.DESC: (name)=(file)\nAdd section (name) found in (file) to output

OPTION.NAME: --rename-section
OPTION.DESC: (old)=(new)[,(flags)]\nRename section (old) to (new)

OPTION.NAME: --long-section-names
OPTION.DESC: Handle long section names in Coff objects.

OPTION.NAME: --change-leading-char
OPTION.DESC: Force output format's leading character style

OPTION.NAME: --remove-leading-char
OPTION.DESC: Remove leading character from global symbols

OPTION.NAME: --reverse-bytes=
OPTION.DESC: Reverse (num) bytes at a time, in output sections with content

OPTION.NAME: --redefine-sym
OPTION.DESC: (old)=(new)\nRedefine symbol name (old) to (new)

OPTION.NAME: --redefine-syms
OPTION.DESC: --redefine-sym for all symbol pairs listed in (file)

OPTION.NAME: --srec-len
OPTION.DESC: (number) Restrict the length of generated Srecords

OPTION.NAME: --srec-forceS3
OPTION.DESC: Restrict the type of generated Srecords to S3

OPTION.NAME: --strip-symbols
OPTION.DESC: -N for all symbols listed in (file)

OPTION.NAME: --strip-unneeded-symbols
OPTION.DESC: --strip-unneeded-symbol for all symbols listed in (file)

OPTION.NAME: --keep-symbols
OPTION.DESC: -K for all symbols listed in (file)

OPTION.NAME: --localize-symbols
OPTION.DESC: -L for all symbols listed in (file)

OPTION.NAME: --globalize-symbols
OPTION.DESC: --globalize-symbol for all in (file)

OPTION.NAME: --keep-global-symbols
OPTION.DESC: -G for all symbols listed in (file)

OPTION.NAME: --weaken-symbols
OPTION.DESC: -W for all symbols listed in (file)

OPTION.NAME: --alt-machine-code
OPTION.DESC: Use the target's (index)'th alternative machine

OPTION.NAME: --writable-text
OPTION.DESC: Mark the output text as writable

OPTION.NAME: --readonly-text
OPTION.DESC: Make the output text write protected

OPTION.NAME: --pure
OPTION.DESC: Mark the output file as demand paged

OPTION.NAME: --impure
OPTION.DESC: Mark the output file as impure

OPTION.NAME: --prefix-symbols
OPTION.DESC: Add (prefix) to start of every symbol name

OPTION.NAME: --prefix-sections
OPTION.DESC: Add (prefix) to start of every section name

OPTION.NAME: --prefix-alloc-sections
OPTION.DESC: Add (prefix) to start of every allocatable section name

OPTION.NAME: --file-alignment
OPTION.DESC: Set PE file alignment to (num)

OPTION.NAME: --heap
OPTION.DESC: (reserve)[,(commit)]\nSet PE reserve/commit heap to (reserve)/(commit)

OPTION.NAME: --image-base
OPTION.DESC: Set PE image base to (address)

OPTION.NAME: --section-alignment
OPTION.DESC: Set PE section alignment to (num)

OPTION.NAME: --stack
OPTION.DESC: (reserve)[,(commit)]\nSet PE reserve/commit stack to (reserve)/(commit)

OPTION.NAME: --subsystem
OPTION.DESC: (name)[:(version)]\nSet PE subsystem to (name) [and (version)]

OPTION.NAME: -v
OPTION.DESC: List all object files modified
